title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
description: Creamy Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, and pancetta
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook pancetta until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheese, and a generous amount of black pepper.
Add minced garlic to the pan with pancetta and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water. Add hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta.
Remove pan from heat and quickly toss pasta with egg mixture, adding pasta water gradually until creamy.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

title: Fluffy Pancakes
description: Light and airy breakfast pancakes that melt in your mouth
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat eggs and then whisk in milk, melted butter, and vanilla.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined (lumps are okay).
Heat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat and butter lightly.
Pour ¼ cup batter per pancake onto griddle.
Cook until bubbles form on surface and edges look set, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook until golden brown on other side, 1-2 minutes more.
Serve hot with maple syrup and butter.

title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
description: Fresh and healthy salad packed with vegetables and Mediterranean flavors
ingredients: 1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted and halved
instructions: Cook quinoa in vegetable broth according to package directions. Let cool completely.
In a large bowl, combine cooled quinoa, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and olives.
Add crumbled feta cheese, parsley, and mint to the bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to let flavors meld.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

title: Chocolate Lava Cake
description: Decadent individual chocolate cakes with molten centers
ingredients: Butter and cocoa powder for ramekins
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Butter 4 ramekins and dust with cocoa powder.
Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler or microwave, stirring until smooth.
In a bowl, whisk eggs, sugar, and salt until thick and pale.
Stir melted chocolate mixture into egg mixture.
Fold in flour until just combined.
Divide batter among prepared ramekins.
Bake for 12-14 minutes until edges are firm but centers still jiggle slightly.
Let cool for 1 minute, then run knife around edges and invert onto plates.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve immediately with ice cream.

title: Veggie Stir-Fry
description: Quick and colorful vegetarian stir-fry with Asian flavors
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add bell pepper, broccoli, and carrot. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add snap peas and mushrooms, continue stir-frying for 2-3 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and honey.
Pour sauce over vegetables and toss to coat.
Add cornstarch slurry and stir until sauce thickens, about 1 minute.
Remove from heat, garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.
Serve immediately over steamed rice.

title: 15-Minute Garlic Shrimp
description: Quick and flavorful shrimp dish perfect for busy weeknights
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1/4 cup white wine or chicken broth
instructions: Season shrimp with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add shrimp and cook for 2 minutes per side until pink. Remove and set aside.
In same skillet, add butter and garlic. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add red pepper flakes and cook for 30 seconds.
Pour in wine or broth and lemon juice, simmer for 2 minutes.
Return shrimp to skillet and toss to coat in sauce.
Remove from heat and stir in fresh parsley.
Serve immediately over pasta or rice.

title: Beef Tacos with Homemade Salsa
description: Authentic beef tacos with fresh, zesty homemade salsa
instructions: Cook ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat until browned.
Add diced onion and garlic, cook until onion is softened.
Season with chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
For salsa: combine tomatoes, red onion, jalapeño, cilantro, and lime juice.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave.
Assemble tacos with beef, cheese, avocado, and salsa.
Serve with sour cream and extra lime wedges.

title: Berry Smoothie Bowl
description: Nutritious and colorful smoothie bowl topped with fresh fruits and nuts
instructions: Blend frozen banana, berries, yogurt, almond milk, and honey until smooth and thick.
Divide smoothie mixture between two bowls.
Top with granola, chia seeds, fresh berries, almonds, and coconut.
Serve immediately while cold.

title: Caprese Salad
description: Classic Italian salad with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices alternately on a serving platter.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Season with salt and pepper.
Finish with a pinch of flaky sea salt.
Let sit for 10 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.

title: Tiramisu Cups
description: Individual portions of the classic Italian dessert
instructions: Whisk egg yolks and sugar in a double boiler until thick and pale.
Remove from heat and whisk in mascarpone until smooth.
Whip cream to soft peaks and fold into mascarpone mixture.
Combine espresso and coffee liqueur in a shallow dish.
Quickly dip each ladyfinger in coffee mixture and layer in cups.
Spread half the mascarpone mixture over cookies.
Repeat with another layer of dipped cookies and remaining cream.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Before serving, dust with cocoa powder and top with chocolate shavings.

title: Chicken Brussel Sprouts Stroganoff
description: Creamy chicken and brussel sprouts served over egg noodles
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through.
Remove chicken and set aside.
In the same pot, add brussel sprouts sauté 3-5 minutes.
Add the heavy cream and chicken broth, cooked chicken and uncooked noodles to the pot and stir to combine.
Cook 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until noodles are tender.
Add parmesan cheese and stir until melted and sauce is creamy.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Tuna Melt
description: Hot tuna submarine sandwich with melted cheese
ingredients: 1 can (5 oz) tuna in water, drained
12 oz container of portobello mushrooms, chopped
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Bake the French loaf according to package instructions until golden brown.
While the loaf is baking place the onions in a pan and saute until translucent.
Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their water and it evaporates.
Add tuna and cook over medium heat on medium heat 10 to 15 minutes or until tuna is has no water coming from in when squeezed.
Add the egg and cook for another 2 minutes or until the egg is cooked.
Remove from heat and stir in mayonnaise and black pepper.
Once the bread is done, slice it in half lengthwise add cheddar to one half and pepper jack to the other.
place back in the oven for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Once the cheese is melted remove from the oven and add the tuna mixture to the bottom half.
Top with the other half of the bread and serve.

title: Bowtie Getti
description: Spaghetti sauce with onions and bell peppers served over bowtie noodles
instructions: In a large skillet, brown the ground beef over medium heat until fully cooked. Drain excess fat.
Add the chopped onion and bell pepper to the skillet. Cook until softened.
Stir in the jar of spaghetti sauce and let simmer for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the bowtie pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Combine the cooked pasta with the meat sauce, mixing well. Serve hot.

title: Hash Brown Casserole
description: A cheesy potato casserole made with hash browns.
ingredients: 32 oz fresh shredded or frozen hash browns (thawed if frozen)
1 (10.5 oz) condensed cream of chicken soup
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, combine hash browns, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, cheddar cheese, onion, and melted butter. Mix well.
Spread the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese on top.
Bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly.

title: Pizza Dough
description: Homemade pizza dough that is easy to make and perfect for any pizza recipe.
instructions: In a small bowl, combine warm water, sugar, and yeast. Let sit for 5 minutes until frothy.
In a large bowl, combine flour and salt. Add yeast mixture and olive oil. Mix until a dough forms.
Knead on a floured surface for 5 minutes until smooth.
Place dough in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in size.
Punch down dough and roll out to fit your pizza pan.

title: Cheese Cake
description: A rich and creamy classic cheesecake with a graham cracker crust.
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C).
In a bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Mix in vanilla extract and sour cream until just combined.
Pour filling over crust in the pan.
Bake for 60 minutes or until the center is almost set.
Turn off oven and let cheesecake cool in the oven with the door slightly open for 1 hour.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

ingredients: 32 oz fresh shredded or frozen hash browns (thawed if frozen)
1 (10.5 oz) condensed cream of chicken soup
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, combine hash browns, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, cheddar cheese, onion, and melted butter. Mix well.
Spread the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese on top.
Bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly.
